intro: Arabidopsis bursifolia, commonly known as the bur-forming Arabidopsis, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known species like mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, typically arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Arabidopsis bursifolia is often used in botanical studies due to its genetic simplicity and adaptability.
